Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision to classify Tomlinson's risk as generalized rather than personal was reasonable under IRPA section 97
Governing_Law: Section 97(1)(b)(ii) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Application_Facts: Tomlinson was targeted due to his brother's actions against a gang, leading to specific threats and attacks; he fled Jamaica after being targeted by a gang because of his brother's police work
Decision_Outcome: The Board erred in its analysis; Tomlinson faced a personalized risk requiring protection under IRPA
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: Application granted; case remanded for re-determination by a different panel
Defendant_Behavior: Board incorrectly deemed the risk as generalized based on Jamaica's crime rates
Grounds_for_Claim: Personalized risk due to association with brother who worked against a gang
Legal_Standard: Requirement of a personalized risk not shared by the general population under IRPA s. 97(1)(b)(ii)
Assessment_Factor: Nature and specificity of threats; connection between harm and individual circumstances
Evidence_Used: Threats and attacks against Tomlinson; context of brother's police work
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to membership in a particular social group (family association)
Evidence_Assessed: Specific incidents of targeting linked to brother's actions
Relief_Sought: Recognition as a protected person; refugee protection
Governing_Rule: A person must face a personalized risk not shared by others in their country to qualify under IRPA s. 97
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Board failed to properly assess individualized risk, relying instead on country conditions
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from gang due to familial association
Cause_Description: Tomlinson fled Jamaica after being targeted by a gang due to his brother's police work
Evidence_Handling: Board inadequately considered personal nature of threats
Evidence_Issues: Failure to distinguish between generalized violence and personalized risk
Evidence_Assessment: Board did not adequately assess evidence of personal targeting
Decision_Rationale: The risk Tomlinson faced was personal, not general; the Boardâ€™s reliance on country condition reports without individualized assessment was unreasonable
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient consideration of personal circumstances in risk assessment
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision-making
